010package imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.nonlinear;
011
012import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
015
016/**
017 * A non-linear mapping that produces a ripple effect.
018 * The transformation is implicitly inverted, i.e., maps target to source image
019 * coordinates.
020 * Note: This class has been deprecated and substituted by an ImageJ plugin.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 *
024 */
025@Deprecated
026public class RippleMapping implements Mapping2D {
027        final double xWavel; // = 20;
028        final double yWavel ; // = 100;
029        final double xAmpl ; // = 0;
030        final double yAmpl ; // = 10;
031   
032        public RippleMapping (double xWavel, double xAmpl, double yWavel, double yAmpl) {
033                this.xWavel = xWavel;
034                this.yWavel = yWavel;
035                this.xAmpl = xAmpl;
036                this.yAmpl = yAmpl;
037        }
038
039        @Override
040        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d pnt) {
041                final double x = pnt.getX();
042                final double y = pnt.getY();
043                double xx = x + xAmpl * Math.sin(y / xWavel);
044                double yy = y + yAmpl * Math.sin(x / yWavel);
045                return PntDouble.from(xx, yy);
046        }
047}
048
